titleStmt.title: Lady Helen Schechter to Thomas Hardy — On Dorchester plays & invitation to Melbury, 17 November [191?]

publicationStmt.p: Unpublished autograph letter held at the Dorset History Centre / Dorset Museum, MS H.3661.

support.p: Small bifolium of pale blue laid paper; written recto of four pages in black ink; deckled edges; light rust marks at inner margin.

layout.p: Single column throughout; closing and signature on p.4.

handNote.p: Flowing right-slanted cursive, even spacing; emphatic underlining for dates and emphasis.

msDesc.note: Later pencil endorsement: “Lady Schechter [191?]”. Shelfmark “H.3661” in pencil on verso.

abstract.p: After seeing Hardy’s plays performed in Dorchester, Lady Helen Schechter writes to express her enjoyment and invites him to visit at Melbury when convenient.

note.p: Lady Helen Schechter (Countess of Mecklenburg‑Strelitz) writes on Abbotsbury Castle stationery. The note comments on a local performance of Hardy’s works and extends a social invitation to visit the Melbury estate near Evershot.

div.p: I feel I must write you a line to tell you how deeply I enjoyed seeing your plays in Dorchester yesterday. I think I have read nearly all your books, but until this year I had never been able to see one of the plays, & yesterday afternoon was certainly a delightful experience.

I have been anxious for some time to ask you whether you would come over and pay us a little visit at Melbury; it would be a great pleasure to both my husband & myself to see you there, if you could spare the time to come to us.
I am going home next week & shall be settled there some time; so perhaps you will try to find a spare minute & visit us.
